title: Findingnemo
author: Findingnemo
content: We have a tool [Script] Imgur to TalkImg - automatically fix your broken images created by TryNinja, which will fix our old invalid images uploaded via Imgur hosting site on bitcointalk.I am wondering if there is any possible way to fix broken images in other people's posts. I'm asking this because quite often, I come across many guides that were created years ago, and they now have broken images. These guides contain valuable details, and if I want to recommend one to a newbie seeking help, having the pictorial details is crucial for them to understand the complete content of the guide.I've had this thought for a while, and I'm sharing it now as it might provide a possible solution for posting guides created by others, with all the images.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: I have noticed this countless number of times and because of it, some guides are no more useful.You can send personal message to the people that have the topic or post to fix the images because that is the best solution. The other solution is to because of that, create your own guide and give a reason about it which is the error images that make the guide not understandable.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Findingnemo on September 12, 2023, 07:41:29 PM~I've had this thought for a while, and I'm sharing it now as it might provide a possible solution for posting guides created by others, with all the images.You can follow _act_'s advice and reach out to the original poster. Or, there is a simple solution you can do yourself:Quote the entire post.While in Edit mode, you will find all the original Imgur links within the quoted text. These should work when accessed directly.Now, you have two options:Manually edit the images by uploading them to the TalkImg service and updating the URL.Publish the post as is and use the Imgur to TalkImg script, which will automate the process for you.Quote from: TryNinja on May 14, 2023, 07:38:14 AM- This will upload and edit all imgur.com links found on your post history (even those inside quotes you made of other people).

Thanks for the idea It will work as a temporary way but we have masterminds and AI members so there is the possibility of coming up with a better way is the actual reason why I brought up this discussion.

comments.author: Bureau
comments.body: The problem is severe, almost all tutorial images were hosted on Imgur. None of those image links are working. For example, when you go through the tutorial for Electrum wallets they are all without images. If you read the contents of those tutorials it won't make any sense as they are related to the screenshot. Either a new set of tutorials needs to be created or the owners of those tutorial should have to fix those image links. As OP mentioned this [Script] Imgur to TalkImg - automatically fix your broken images can be used but it can be only done by those who wrote those tutorials.
